thread.title: CICC Plans $1 Billion Hong Kong IPO
thread.title_full: CICC Plans $1 Billion Hong Kong IPO

title: CICC Plans $1 Billion Hong Kong IPO
text:
CICC Plans $1 Billion Hong Kong IPO Chinese investment bank China International Capital Corp. plans to list in October at the earliest By Yvonne Lee Updated July 13, 2015 7:24 p.m. ET 
HONG KONG—China International Capital Corp. is planning to raise US$1 billion in an initial public offering in Hong Kong as early as October, people familiar with the situation said, offering shareholders KKR & Co. and TPG Capital the chance to exit their investments despite turmoil in Chinese stocks. 
The Beijing investment bank, which made its name advising state-owned firms that have gone public in Hong Kong over the past decade, plans to submit an application to Hong Kong’s stock exchange seeking approval for the... To Read the Full Story, Subscribe or Sign In Popular on WSJ
